item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
This story reminded me of that fumbling cybersex example that was floating around the web a few years back where the guy uses scissors to cut off the woman's clothes. As I went to hunt down that link, which I believe I originally read on Something Awful, I ran across this <a href="http://www.geeky-boy.com/fun/cyber1.html" rel="nofollow">little bit of drama</a> between the author of "Realistic Cybersex" and many of the sites that were running the piece (originally published in July 1996 Playboy?).
Anyways, you can find "Realistic Cybersex" all over the net with a Google, although I prefer this one since it appears unstaged and <a href="http://flickr.com/photos/afkgamer/91379665/">Chet's screams</a> of "DO U KNOW WHO I AM? I AM IMPORTANT" are priceless.
item.content:encoded:
This story reminded me of that fumbling cybersex example that was floating around the web a few years back where the guy uses scissors to cut off the woman’s clothes. As I went to hunt down that link, which I believe I originally read on Something Awful, I ran across this little bit of drama between the author of “Realistic Cybersex” and many of the sites that were running the piece (originally published in July 1996 Playboy?).

Anyways, you can find “Realistic Cybersex” all over the net with a Google, although I prefer this one since it appears unstaged and Chet’s screams of “DO U KNOW WHO I AM? I AM IMPORTANT” are priceless.

item.title: By: Heartless_
item.dc:creator: Heartless_
item.description:
Say it ain't so...
I sadly know a wife/husband duo that play on Thunderlord and even worse I work with the husband. As far as I'm concerned this is him and his wife... buahahahahaha.
item.content:encoded:
Say it ain’t so…

I sadly know a wife/husband duo that play on Thunderlord and even worse I work with the husband. As far as I’m concerned this is him and his wife… buahahahahaha.

item.title: By: Anon
item.dc:creator: Anon
item.description: Ha! I'll never get tired of seeing cybering peeps get busted - why don't they ever just use /whisper instead?
item.content:encoded: Ha! I’ll never get tired of seeing cybering peeps get busted – why don’t they ever just use /whisper instead?
